value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sONvctPlplY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Fridays! #24: Running/ Cumulative totals (w Pareto chart)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to calculate cumulative totals or running totals with DAX/ powerpivot.  We will calculate running totals with a Date and with another column (not a date).  Link to Matt's Blog post: http://exceleratorbi.com.au/cumulative-running-total-based-on-highest-value/  Link to

value.title: DAX Fridays! #25: Wrong Grand Totals in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through why sometimes Power BI grand totals dont add up and what to do to fix it.  Link to Power BI file used in the video, get file #41 on the community downloads folder: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. It is very useful for solving issues with many to many relationships and performance issues.  Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #52: SUMIF, COUNTIF
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through one of the most common asked quesitons for DAX beginners: How do I calculate a SUMIF or COUNTIF in DAX? value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going through the DAX function KEEPFILTERS. KEEPFILTERS will remove the behaviour that CALCULATE has where it removes the filters available.  Looking for Part 1 video?  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ewjRItLlgG8  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/keepfilters-function-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.   For example, if you want to calculate the sum of sales between two specific dates, this is the perfect function for you.  You can "hardcode" the

value.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI
value.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI.  During this session, we will cover the following things: • Real-life example where we need Cumulative Sum 00:21

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. value.title: DAX CrossFilter Function in Power BI   Write the Formula both directional but keep the relationship

A both-directional relationship comes at a cost, which is mainly the performance and ambiguity of the model. There is a way to write

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE. Link to the previous ISINSCOPE video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sSUCyps_1O4
